com.tome25.utils.json

Interface JsonElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonArray, JsonObject

    public interface JsonElement
extends java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.io.Serializable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object add(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Adds the Value with the given key if there are no Object with this Key.
      default JsonElement changes(JsonElement from)
      returns a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one.
      JsonElement changes(JsonElement from, boolean recursive)
      returns a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one.

      Clears this Json.
      java.lang.Object clone()
      Creates and returns a copy of this Json Object.

      Creates and returns a copy of this Json Object.

      checks whether this Json contains the given object, either as key if the type matches, or as value.
      boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
      returns true if this Json contains the given key.
      boolean containsValue(java.lang.Object value)
      returns true if this Json contains the given value.
      default java.lang.String contentToString(java.lang.Object content)
      converts the given object to a string in the way intended for jsons to match the json specifications.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.
      java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
      gets the value for the given key.
      java.lang.String getString(java.lang.Object key)
      gets the value for the given key if its a string, or a string representation of that value if it isn't.
      default java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> getValues()
      returns this jsons Values.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether this json is empty.
      java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Adds the given value to the given key replacing the current value if it already exists.
      void putAll(java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.Object,? extends java.lang.Object> m)
      Adds the given values to the given keys replacing the current ones if existing.
      default JsonElement reconstruct(JsonElement from)
      returns a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied.
      JsonElement reconstruct(JsonElement from, boolean recursive)
      returns a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied.
      void remove(java.lang.Object o, boolean key)
      if key is true this removes the object to the key o from this Json, if not it removes the value o from this Json.
      java.lang.Object set(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Adds the given value to the given key replacing the current value if it already exists.

      Adds the given values to the given keys replacing the current ones if existing.
      int size()
      gets the size of this object.
      default boolean supportsChanges()
      Checks whether this element supports getting the changes against a given version.
      default boolean supportsClone()
      Checks whether this JsonElement can be cloned.

      Returns a string representation of this element as byte array.

      Returns a string representation of this element as character array.

      Returns a string representation of this element.

                     java.lang.Object value)
        Adds the Value with the given key if there are no Object with this Key.
        Parameters:
        key - the Key to add.
        value - the value to add for key.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - when there already an Object with this Key.
        InvalidTypeException - if the key type doesn't match the key type for this object(String for JsonObjects, Integer for JsonArrays)

        Checks whether this element supports getting the changes against a given version.

      • changes

        default JsonElement changes(JsonElement from)
                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        returns a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one. Recursive. This marks removed values by setting them to null, so it will not fully work with JsonElements containing null objects.
        Parameters:
        from - the previous JsonElement
        Returns:
        a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this JsonElement doesn't support generating a changes json.

      • changes

        JsonElement changes(JsonElement from,
                    boolean recursive)
             throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        returns a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one. This marks removed values by setting them to null, so it will not fully work with JsonElements containing null objects.
        Parameters:
        from - the previous JsonElement
        recursive - whether changed JsonElements inside this one should get checked for changes too, or just cloned from this one.
        Returns:
        a new JsonElement containing the changes from the given JsonElement to this one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this JsonElement doesn't support generating a changes json.

      • reconstruct

        default JsonElement reconstruct(JsonElement from)
                         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        returns a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied. Recursive. This marks removed values by setting them to null, so it will not fully work with JsonElements containing null objects.
        Parameters:
        from - the previous JsonElement
        Returns:
        a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this JsonElement doesn't support generating a changes json.

      • reconstruct

        JsonElement reconstruct(JsonElement from,
                        boolean recursive)
        returns a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied. This marks removed values by setting them to null, so it will not fully work with JsonElements containing null objects.
        Parameters:
        from - the previous JsonElement
        recursive - whether changedJsonElements inside this one should get reconstructed too, or just cloned from this one.
        Returns:
        a new JsonElement containing the values of the given JsonElement with the changes contained in this JsonElement applied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this JsonElement doesn't support generating a changes json.

      • contentToString

        default java.lang.String contentToString(java.lang.Object content)
        converts the given object to a string in the way intended for jsons to match the json specifications.
        Parameters:
        content -
        Returns:
        a string representation of the given object.
